title: Face Recognition Based on Image Sets
segmentation: Hello, my name is Hakan Chevy cart and I am from Skyros Magazine University in Turkey.
Today I'm going to present our work on face recognition using image set.
This is a joint work with Bill tricks AJC lap in Grenoble France.
This is the outline of my talk.
First, I will make an introduction and try to motivate the idea behind using a image set for face recognition and then I will briefly mention related methods in our proposed method.

1st I'm going to mention from convex set we use for approximating image set and then I will show how to compute the distance between these models and then this will be followed by extension of tomato to nonlinear case which is also known as the canalization.
And then experiment.

In conclusion, OK, so here in this framework we are given a set of images of an unknown individual rather than a single image an on the right you can see a two image set belonging to individuals and images in the set can be collected from surveillance application or they may come from personal image, calories collected overtime and also we have image sets for.
The known individuals in the Gallery and our goal is to find the Gallery member whose image set is the best match for the given query set.
Of course, this is a hard test because images in both query and Gallery set may contain large variation in post elimination and scale.
OK, let's compare this framework to the traditional face recognition methods using only single images.

In traditional methods, in traditional face recognition methods, using only single images, the methods are usually trained with images capture under control environments and also during testing testing phase people are expected to follow some rules, for example like standing in front of the camera.
And because of these things when they are tested under more realistic environments the metals may fail easily.
On the other hand, if we are using image set for face recognition.
Well, we can incorporate it.
The information about the variability of the subject appearance, of course is a good thing.
And also we can easily collect this image set from.
I don't know like without needing kind without needing any kind of cooperation from people.
So this framework is more accommodating compared to traditional face recognition method using single images.
OK, so there are basically two important elements on face recognition methods using image set.
The first one is the model.
Use for approximating image set and the other one is how to compute the similarity or distance between these models.
For example here Fiskaa Bonanza Sermon used linear affine subspaces for approximating image sets and they use joint manifold distance to find the distance between them.
We are also using a final approximation but instead of linear finals we are also extended to matter to the nonlinear case.
So, and also instead of joint manifold distance, we are using geometric distance between the finals OK in this study.
The authors used.
Parametric distribution function.
Approximate image set and the distance between them are computed by using callback library Divergance and Yamaguchi at all here.
Approximated image set with linear subspaces and they use Canonical angles in order to compute.
The similarities between the linear subspaces.

OK, recent methods begin to use manifold learning approach and in this the basic idea behind manifold learning is to approximate each image set with a nonlinear smooth manifold constructed by combining linear pitches.
So all three methods given here differ how they determine those linear patches and how they model them.
Once those linear pitches are extracted, they compute the distances and the final decision is based on majority voting.

For example, here at NPR, ticking and 1st Applied dimensional reduction and then introduced space they applied K means clustering in order to determine the linear patches and then in order to represent those linear patches, they use cluster centers.
Here Fagnant use hierarchical clustering in order to determine.

Linear pitches and each linear pitch is represented by a linear subspace and recently vang and all use a kind of nearest neighbor clustering to determine linear pitches and each linear pitch is represented with a linear subspace plus cluster center.
In order to, we also tested this method, but in order to be consistent I use spectral clustering in order to determine those linear patches.
And beside this models.
I also tested a final approximation for linear pictures as well.

Define combination coefficients that the only constraint is that the sum of this coefficient must be equal to 1.

You can see here the final obtained by using affine combination of this 4 sample vectors here and you see this is the plane and it's the kind of rather lose model for approximating image set if you are using convex hulls we need additional non negativity constraints on this coefficients and also you can see here the convex Hull constructed by using convex combination of these 4 sample as well.
And you see comparative finals.
These are kind of tight structures.

To do so we use geometric distance between between the affine or convex cells and.
In order to determine the geometric distance, we first need to find the closest points on these convex set and the geometric distances just equivalent to distance between the closest point.

OK for the finals in the linear case there is a close form solution to compute the distances, but in order to extend the metal to the nonlinear case and also at the same time to cope with outliers, we use another formulation based on quadratic programming, the 1st in order.
In case of outliers, in order to reduce the effects of those outliers, we have to reduce our A finals and we do is by.
Introducing lower and upper bounds on this coefficients and then finding the distance between two readies a finance becomes this quadratic optimization.
Problem and whoops.

So this objective function of this problem is convex, so that means that a global minimum exists and once we compute the optimal Alpha coefficients here, the distance can be computed by using this equation here.

OK, in the convex Hull case, we can use the same formulation, but the only thing we have to do we have to set the lower bound to zero and in case of outliers if you would like to reduce convex style we have to set the upper bound some values smaller than one.
OK, so here we I mentioned a linear convex set for approximating image set.

But if this linear models are not appropriate for modeling image sets, so this may be because of the face image manifolds are complex and nonlinear, in this case to handle this kind of cases we can extend the method to nonlinear case by using kernel trick.
So the only thing we have to do here note that our objective function can be written.

In terms of that, products of the samples, so the only thing we have to do we have to replace all this inner products with the kernel function evaluation so we can in this case easily compute the distance between nonlinear image manifolds more accurately.
